conclusion: Displacement of an object between two instants is given by the area under its v-t curve during that interval.
Both cars start with the same speed v₁ at t = 0.
Between 0 and t₁, the curve for Car A lies everywhere above the curve for Car B except at the single instant where they cross.
The area under Car A’s curve is larger than the area under Car B’s curve.
The displacement of Car A is larger than the displacement of Car B.
The displacements are different; Car A covers the greater distance.
